title: Mario Balotelli can QUADRUPLE his Brescia salary to £3.2m a year
text:
A bonus in Mario Balotelli's contract with Brescia could see the striker quadruple his salary to £3.5million a year if he performs well.

The fiery Italian striker joined the Serie A minnows in the summer as a free agent after his contract with Marseille expired following the conclusion of last summer.

Balotelli was required to take a pay cut to join his hometown team but now it is claimed his salary could rise by four times if he meets a number of criteria.

A bonus in Mario Balotelli's contract with Brescia could see his salary quadruple to £3.5m

According to Italian outlet Corriere della Sera, Balotelli earns a guaranteed wage of €1million (£877,000) a year.

But if Brescia, who were promoted to Italy's top flight last season, can avoid relegation and Balotelli nets at least 15 goals during the campaign he can earn a lucrative €3m (£2.6m).

However, it is also claimed that if Brescia are relegated over the course of the next three seasons his contract will be 'dissolved'.

Balotelli struck his first Brescia goal in the 2-1 defeat by Napoli in his second appearance

The former Manchester City and Liverpool striker sat out the first four matches of the season through suspension.

He has since played twice for his new club, playing every minute of matches against Juventus and Napoli.

Balotelli struck his first Brescia goal in the 2-1 defeat by Carlo Ancelotti's side before the international break.
